attributes.action: Pay cut for Government Workers in Tier 2 and 3
attributes.additional_details:
All these measures that are put in place are mainly affecting those in the private sector, but all decisions are being made by those in the public sector. The measures need to be reflected across the board so that we are all truly "in this together". 

Currently, government's are taking control of people's business's, income, and sometimes right to work without any consequence to their own way of living. This is not democratic.
attributes.background: All those who work for the local government, including civil servants and the local MP, whose constituents are put into tier 2 and 3 level restrictions should be forced to accept a pay cut in line with the government measures.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/

Local government salaries are a matter for local authorities and not the UK Government or Parliament.
